title: Do you think solipsism is real? - Quora

response.answer_text: It can't be logically proven wrong. But I find it impossible to accept considering what surprising things "the world" can do to me. I can't tickle myself, that doesn't work but others can. It is no proof but… Jokes with a surprising twist make me laugh. I am not very funny but when I come up with a joke myself once in a while it feels like "Eureka!" not "Hahaha" it is different… Although I consider myself a smart ass :-), I have been taught things by people: conclusions I could never have come up with on my own. The world just seems to big and complex for solipsism to be a real option. It's bigger than me!

If you accept solipsism, then you have to accept that all of the creativity in the world comes from you. You are Shakespeare, Sappho, Hildegard of Bingen, Mahler, Ada Lovelace, Salvador Dali, Julie Mehretu, Rilke, Emily Dickinson, Laoze, Kurt Godel, Sylvia Plath… Do you really think that is possible? If true, then your solipsistic consciousness is hiding things from you. In effect it is partitioned into other conciousnesses that have access to talents and abilities that are not available to your reasoning self. Almost like there are other people. Absurd things can be real, but solipsism is absurd. Thinking solipsisticly’s sticky.

I'm sorry but if you think about it, this is a rather pointless question. If "solipsism is real" then the only person really existing would be you, the questioner. If you're the only who really exists, how can you ask me, an ontologically unreal person to answer that. If I say "yes solipsism is real" then what it means is that I'm the only person who really exists, but if John says solipsism is real then, to him, he's the only person who really exists, and if you say it, then you're the only person who really exists. If solipsism is "real" then I, the person answering, am not a real person but a mere figment of your mind so in essence my answer on solipsism is the result of your mind. Another person cannot answer to you whether solipsism is "real".

you must mean to ask, is solipsism a fact? Short answer…. no Solipsism is the view or theory that the self is all that can be known to exist. This is not true. We have a collective-subconscious, or we know the will of the group without communications. And, there are people who at times can engage and know another person’s mind. In western cultures, this collectiveness and interconnectedness has been repressed. I think this collectiveness also engages animals…. S.V. I do not know if there are any persons out there sharing one mind and one soul (spiritual aggregates), but its possible, for a short duration anyway.

Who knows. But if there’s a creator, it’s a definite possibility. Why create 7 billion people and make them live together? If God wants to create and develop a soul, why not give him his own personal world to live in. It’s no extra work… at least not for someone capable of building this universe.

It can be real, but how you can you tell if it is real or not? With the things we know, we can not say if it is real or not. Maybe if we discover the limits of the conscience or how to disguise between 2 consciences then we would know if is only one conscience living at the same time in all the beings, or many consciences.
